name: Blueberry Banana Baked Oatmeal
description: Fresh fruit and rich, custardy oats make this baked oatmeal a filling and flavorful "fix ahead" breakfast. Just heat and eat each morning!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees. Mash the bananas in a measuring cup, starting with two or three and adding more until you have 1.5 cups of banana mash.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees. Mash the bananas in a measuring cup, starting with two or three and adding more until you have 1.5 cups of banana mash.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the banana mash in the large bowl with the eggs, sugar, vanilla, salt, and baking powder. Whisk to combine. Add the milk and whisk again until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the banana mash in the large bowl with the eggs, sugar, vanilla, salt, and baking powder. Whisk to combine. Add the milk and whisk again until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the dry old-fashioned oats. Lastly, stir in the frozen blueberries (keeping them frozen and stirring them in last helps prevent the entire mix from turning purple). Spray an 8×8 inch baking dish with non-stick spray and then pour in the oat mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the dry old-fashioned oats. Lastly, stir in the frozen blueberries (keeping them frozen and stirring them in last helps prevent the entire mix from turning purple). Spray an 8×8 inch baking dish with non-stick spray and then pour in the oat mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated 375 degree oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the center is no longer wet to the touch.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated 375 degree oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the center is no longer wet to the touch.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make, but not much flavor as is.  I used brown sugar, but next time would try adding maple syrup and walnuts. Maybe some cinnamon.  I ate with plain greek yogurt. I cooked at 375 but kicked it up for last 10 minutes to 385.

I found this a little flavorless, but my husband started added a couple things to make it amazing! He takes a slice and spreads natural peanut butter on top, then a dollop of vanilla Greek yogurt and fresh raspberries. So good!

Love this recipe and all the other baked oatmeal recipes on Budget Bytes - I have made them in weekly rotation for breakfast for probably 10 years now and with all the variations I've yet to get sick of them.

Could your team please try a peaches and cream recipe? I've tried it on my own, thinking I had the formula down, but it came out super bland.

I didn't have blueberries available, so I combined this recipe with the apple pie one (as I have semi-old apples). The eggs make it taste a little off and more eggy then expected. I do have some sort of sensitivity to eggs (deviled eggs or plain eggs make me barf but eggs in waffles, cheesecake, cakes and the like is perfectly fine.) Next time I'm trying it without any eggs and so. much. more cinamon.

This was fab! Added some frozen raspberries and half a tin of peaches as I needed to get rid of them. Also, halved everything as I was only making it for me.

Will make again.
Thank you so much for letting me know. I’m so excited to try this combo.
Can I use fresh chopped peaches in this ? Instead of blueberries. I’d like to try it . What are your thoughts on this Beth. Thanks
